00001 /*
00002  *******************************************************
00003  *              UPSAMPLE A SIGNAL - USE WHEN A SIGNAL HAS BEEN 
00004  *              DOWNSAMPLED AND NEEDS TO BE RECONSTITUTED
00005  *******************************************************
00006  *              Tap.Tools Blue Object
00007  *              copyright © 2003 by Timothy A. Place
00008  *
00009  */
00010 
00011 // Check against redundant including
00012 #ifndef TT_UPSAMPLE_H
00013 #define TT_UPSAMPLE_H
00014 
00015 // Include appropriate headers
00016 #include "tt_audio_base.h"
00017 
00018 
00019 /********************************************************
00020         CLASS INTERFACE/IMPLEMENTATION
00021 
00022         The entire class is implemented inline for speed.
00023  ********************************************************/
00024 
00025 class tt_upsample:public tt_audio_base{
00026 
00027         private:
00028                 tt_attribute_value_discrete     factor;                 // should be a power of 2
00029         
00030         public:
00031                 enum selectors{                                                                 // Attribute Selectors
00032                         k_factor,
00033                 };
00034                 
00035 
00036                 // OBJECT LIFE                                  
00037                 tt_upsample()                                                                   // Constructor          
00038                 {
00039                         set_attr(k_factor, 1);                                          // default: no upsampling
00040                 }
00041 
00042                 ~tt_upsample()                                                                  // Destructor
00043                 {
00044                         ;
00045                 }
00046 
00047 
00048                 // ATTRIBUTES
00049                 void set_attr(tt_selector sel, tt_attribute_value_discrete val) // Set Attributes
00050                 {
00051                         switch (sel){
00052                                 case k_factor:
00053                                         factor = val;
00054                                         break;
00055                         }
00056                 }
00057 
00058                 tt_attribute_value_discrete get_attr(tt_selector sel)                   // Get Attributes
00059                 {
00060                         switch (sel){
00061                                 case k_factor:
00062                                         return factor;
00063                                 default:
00064                                         return 0;
00065                         }
00066                 }
00067                 
00068                 
00069                 // DSP LOOP
00070                 void dsp_vector_calc(tt_audio_signal *in, tt_audio_signal *out)
00071                 {
00072                         short                   up_size;
00073                         tt_sample_value temp;
00074                         temp_vs = out->vectorsize / factor;
00075 
00076                         while(temp_vs--){
00077                                 up_size = factor;
00078                                 temp = *in->vector++;
00079                                 
00080                                 while(up_size--){
00081                                         *out->vector++ = temp;
00082                                 }
00083                         }
00084                         in->reset(); out->reset();
00085                 }
00086 
00087                 // DSP LOOP - STEREO
00088                 void dsp_vector_calc(tt_audio_signal *in1, tt_audio_signal *in2, 
00089                         tt_audio_signal *out1, tt_audio_signal *out2)
00090                 {
00091                         short                   up_size;
00092                         tt_sample_value temp1, temp2;
00093                         temp_vs = out1->vectorsize / factor;
00094 
00095                         while(temp_vs--){
00096                                 up_size = factor;
00097                                 temp1 = *in1->vector++;
00098                                 temp2 = *in2->vector++;
00099                                 
00100                                 while(up_size--){
00101                                         *out1->vector++ = temp1;
00102                                         *out2->vector++ = temp2;
00103                                 }
00104                         }
00105                         in1->reset(); in2->reset(); out1->reset(); out2->reset();
00106                 }
00107 
00108 };
00109 
00110 
00111 #endif  // TT_UPSAMPLE_H
